newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria says crude oil leaked from pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Algeria says crude oil leaked from pipeline.

text.p: About 200 cubic metres of crude oil poured into the sea in Algeria's Skikda terminal when a pipeline ruptured at the weekend, the official Algerian news agency APS said on Tuesday.
Skikda on the northeast coast is Algeria's main oil and gas export outlet.
The agency did not specify whether the leak had stopped but quoted an official with the state-owned oil and gas firm Sonatrach as saying "repairs to the leak are following their normal course."
The agency, apparently reacting to local media reports of pollution, quoted the official as saying:
"The crude oil stains have been eliminated from the sea... and floating booms were put out in the sea waters to prevent the oil spreading."
Algerian newspaper reports said Sunday's oil leak from the cracked pipeline totalled more than 5,000 cubic metres and had killed hundreds of fishs.
Neither the official nor the newspaper reports said what caused the pipeline rupture.
